task.title: DocBook to PDF Output Customization
task.shortdesc: Main steps for customization of PDF output generated from DocBook XML documents.

context.p: When the default layout and output look of the DocBook to PDF transformation need to be customized, the following main steps should be followed. In this example a company logo image is added to the front matter of a book. Other types of customizations should follow some similar steps.

step.cmd: Create a custom version of the DocBook title spec file.

info.p: You should start from a copy of the file [Oxygen-install-dir]/frameworks/docbook/xsl/fo/titlepage.templates.xml and customize it. The instructions for the spec file can be found here.

step.cmd: Generate a new XSLT stylesheet from the title spec file from the previous step.
step.info: Apply [Oxygen-install-dir]/frameworks/docbook/xsl/template/titlepage.xsl to the title spec file. The result is an XSLT stylesheet, let's call it mytitlepages.xsl.

step.cmd: Import mytitlepages.xsl in a DocBook customization layer.
step.info: The customization layer is the stylesheet that will be applied to the XML document. The mytitlepages.xsl should be imported with an element like:<xsl:import href="dir-name/mytitlepages.xsl"/>

step.cmd: Insert logo image in the XML document.
step.info: The path to the logo image must be inserted in the book/info/mediaobject element of the XML document.

step.cmd: Apply the customization layer to the XML document.
step.info: A quick way is duplicating the transformation scenario DocBook PDF that comes with Oxygen and set the customization layer in the XSL URL property of the scenariothe XSL URL property of the scenario.

link.desc: The book DocBook XSL: The Complete Guide by Bob Stayton contains more details about customizing the PDF output.
Video demonstration for creating a DocBook customization layer in Oxygen.
